title: Scalars and vectors - claim about vector sum

content.question: Vectors <math alttext="vector A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mover accent="true"><mi>A</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="vector B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mover accent="true"><mi>B</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></mstyle></math> are parallel to the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis. Vector <math alttext="vector C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mover accent="true"><mi>C</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></mstyle></math> is defined to be the vector sum of <math alttext="vector A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mover accent="true"><mi>A</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="vector B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mover accent="true"><mi>B</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></mstyle></math>, or <math alttext="vector C equals, vector A plus vector B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mover accent="true"><mi>C</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mover accent="true"><mi>A</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><mover accent="true"><mi>B</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></mstyle></math>. Vector <math alttext="vector C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mover accent="true"><mi>C</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></mstyle></math> has the same direction as vector <math alttext="vector B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mover accent="true"><mi>B</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></mstyle></math> and the magnitudes of <math alttext="vector B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mover accent="true"><mi>B</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="vector C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mover accent="true"><mi>C</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></mstyle></math> are related by <math alttext="the absolute value of vector B, is greater than the absolute value of vector C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>|</mo><mover accent="true"><mi>B</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>|</mo><mo>></mo><mo>|</mo><mover accent="true"><mi>C</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>|</mo></mstyle></math>. Which of the following claims is correct about the relative directions and magnitudes of vectors <math alttext="vector A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mover accent="true"><mi>A</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="vector B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mover accent="true"><mi>B</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="the absolute value of vector A, is greater than the absolute value of vector B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>|</mo><mover accent="true"><mi>A</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>|</mo><mo>></mo><mo>|</mo><mover accent="true"><mi>B</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>|</mo></mstyle></math> and the vectors have the same direction.

<math alttext="the absolute value of vector A, is greater than the absolute value of vector B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>|</mo><mover accent="true"><mi>A</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>|</mo><mo>></mo><mo>|</mo><mover accent="true"><mi>B</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>|</mo></mstyle></math> and the vectors have opposite directions.

<math alttext="the absolute value of vector A, is less than than the absolute value of vector B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>|</mo><mover accent="true"><mi>A</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>|</mo><mo><</mo><mo>|</mo><mover accent="true"><mi>B</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>|</mo></mstyle></math> and the vectors have the same direction.

<math alttext="the absolute value of vector A, is less than than the absolute value of vector B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>|</mo><mover accent="true"><mi>A</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>|</mo><mo><</mo><mo>|</mo><mover accent="true"><mi>B</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>|</mo></mstyle></math> and the vectors have opposite directions.
